Submodules

interface.actions module

interface.actions.calculate_late_penalty(delayed_time: timedelta, thresholds: List[timedelta], penalties: List[int]) → int[source]

Calculates the late submission penalty that should be added to a student based on how delayed the submission is. The number of late submission brackets is decided by taking the minimum number of elements available in two lists, thresholds and penalties.

Parameters:

  • delayed_time – How late the submission is from the deadline

  • thresholds – A list containing threshold values for each late submission bracket

  • penalties – A list of penalties for each bracket

Returns:

The submission penalty as an integer

Parameters:

  • term –

  • dest_path –

interface.actions.check_pre_download_conditions(destination_path: str, lab_name: str) → bool[source]
interface.actions.check_submission_time(available_classes: List[str], lab_path: str, deadline: Deadline, assign=False, print_outputs=True) → Dict[str, datetime][source]

Takes the available classes and the lab path as the input and checks the time of the last submission for each student. Opens the log file of each submission and reads the final line to get the last submitted time. Then compares this value with the curr_deadline. If the deadline is exceeded, based on the delayed time calculates the penalty.

Parameters:

  • available_classes – List of available classes for selected lab

  • lab_path – Absolute file path to the lab folder containing the classes

  • deadline – Deadline for the selected lab

  • assign – If ture, uses assignment deadline parameters

  • print_outputs – If true, the prompt and submission times will also be printed

Returns:

A dictionary containing student id as key and the final submission timestamp as the value

interface.actions.download_labs_all_classes(ssh_client: Client, term: str, lab_name: str, class_names: List[str], save_path: str)[source]
interface.actions.get_deadline_info(deadline: Deadline, assign=False) → Tuple[datetime, List[timedelta], List[int]][source]
interface.actions.get_user_selection(available_options: List[str], selection_type: str = 'Labs') → str[source]

Given a list of lab names, print them to the console in a user-friendly format and waits for the user to make a selection. The selection is validated against non-integer and out of range inputs.

Parameters:

  • selection_type –

  • available_options – A list of labs

Returns:

Name on the user selected lab

interface.actions.lab_selection(local_all_labs_path: str) → Tuple[List[str], str][source]

Lists down all available labs in the given path and prompts the user to pick a specific lab number. If the input lab number is present, returns all class names under the given lab and their respective directory paths

Parameters:

local_all_labs_path – Path of the local save location of all labs

Returns:

The available class names (eg: ‘fri09-oboe’) in the lab and the path of the lab directory

interface.actions.print_and_get_sub_selection(lab_names: List[str]) → int[source]

Print all the labs in the list to the terminal with the corresponding index. Then waits for the user input to select a lab based on the index. Returns the selected lab index to the calling function. Performs basic input verification.

Parameters:

lab_names – A list of lab names as strings

Returns:

The index of the selected lab
